## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm running an older version of my Verus wallet and I want to make sure I'm up to date. How can I update my Verus wallet to the latest version?

**AI Assistant:**
Updating your Verus wallet is a relatively straightforward process. To update your Verus wallet, you'll need to follow a series of steps. First, back up your wallet.dat file. Then, download the latest Verus bootstrap file (VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz) and extract its contents into your .komodo/VRSC folder (on Linux) or %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC folder (on Windows). That should do the trick! Do you have any other questions about updating your wallet?

**User:**
Actually, yes, I do. I'm also using Komodo's Agama wallet and I want to make sure I can still support KMD native within the Verus wallet. What do I need to do?

**AI Assistant:**
If you're installing Verus alongside Komodo's Agama wallet or want to support KMD native within the Verus wallet, you'll need to sync the entire Komodo blockchain again due to the new Zcash Params. To save time syncing, you can download a recent KMD bootstrap file (KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz) and extract its contents into your .komodo folder (on Linux) or %appdata%\Komodo folder (on Windows). That should allow you to use both wallets seamlessly.

**User:**
Okay, I've updated my wallet and set everything up. How do I launch the updated Verus wallet for the first time?

**AI Assistant:**
When launching the updated Verus wallet for the first time, select VRSC under the "Native Mode" dropdown. You'll be prompted to download the latest Zcash Params; follow the steps to do so. That's it! Your Verus wallet should now be up and running with the latest updates. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
How can I update my Verus wallet to the latest version?

To update your Verus wallet, you'll need to follow a series of steps. First, back up your wallet.dat file. Then, download the latest Verus bootstrap file (VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz) and extract its contents into your .komodo/VRSC folder (on Linux) or %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC folder (on Windows).

:
tar -xvf VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz -C .komodo/VRSC
Windows:
Open your browser and paste the following URL
https://bootstrap.0x03.services/veruscoin/VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz
You may need 7-Zip to unzip this file.
Delete the contents of your %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC folder, ensuring your wallet.dat file was backed up in Step 1.
When the file completes downloading, unzip the contents into the following folder: %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC
Note:
New wallet.dat files will be generated in these folders during the first launch of the updated Verus wallet while it syncs up, you’ll overwrite these files later with your backed-up wallet if you are updating.
STEP 4 (Optional) — Get Recent KMD Bootstrap
If you are installing Verus alongside a version of Komodo’s Agama wallet, or you would like support for KMD native within Verus wallet, you’ll need to sync the entire Komodo blockchain again due to the new Zcash Params which come with this latest version of Verus. Since the KMD blockchain is so large, it’s recommended to download a recent bootstrap to save time syncing.
Linux:
From the terminal, navigate to your home folder with cd ~ and download the latest KMD bootstrap by issuing the following command:
wget https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz
After the download completes, unpack the file into your .komodo folder with the following command:
tar -xvf KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz -C .komodo
Windows:
Open your browser and paste the following URL
https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz
You may need 7-Zip to unzip this file.
When the file completes downloading, unzip the contents into the following folder: %appdata%\Komodo
STEP 5 — First, Launch Verus Wallet
On first launch of the newly updated Verus wallet choose VRSC under the “Native Mode” drop down.
You’ll receive a modal prompt to download the latest Zcash Params, follow the steps to do so.
After the Zcash Pa
